intro: Ficus uniauriculata, commonly known as the single-ear fig, is a species of flowering plant in the Moraceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and unique, single-lobed leaf structure, which gives it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by edible fig fruits. This species is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
